comments.creator: rumcic@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; en) Opera 8.52
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060304 Firefox/1.6a1

It writes into the javascript console:
Error: uncaught exception: [Exception... "Component returned failure code: 0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE) [nsIDOMNSHTMLInputElement.selectionStart]"  nsresult: "0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE)"  location: "JS frame :: http://xxx/index.php?page=timetable&subpage=edit&group=8&date=2006-03-04&time=21:00:00 :: cloneObject :: line 144"  data: no]

(switched the ip with "xxx")

tried it with ff 1.5.0.1 and latest nightly build, all in windows ... works in latest opera and msie 6.0.2900.2180...

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open the page
2. click on the image called puscica-gor.jpg

Actual Results:  
except the error nothing ... it should switch 2 values, but it does not (the arrow up (puscica-gor.jpg) image

Expected Results:  
It should switch the values of the hidden field that is right next to the image and the one that is previous to it and then submit the form

comments.text:
Created attachment 214008
The test page where it fails

I don't get any JS errors on that page. And also, please attach a minimized testcase showing the issue. There is a lot of HTML on that page that I am sure is not needed to trigger the error. Also remove unnecessary JS (rollover js) that is not needed to show the bug. Makes it easier to see if there is a bug

fabian.jakobs@web.de
comments.author: fabian.jakobs@web.de
comments.raw_text:
This is a simplified test case. The problem is that Firefox throws an exception if the selectionStart property is accessed, while the input element or one of its parents has 'display:none' set.

The bug should be renamed.
comments.text:
Created attachment 306004
Simplified test case

This is a simplified test case. The problem is that Firefox throws an exception if the selectionStart property is accessed, while the input element or one of its parents has 'display:none' set.

The bug should be renamed.

comments.creator: fabian.jakobs@web.de
comments.raw_text: The testcase works fine in Opera and Webkit. Both return 0.
comments.author: fabian.jakobs@web.de
comments.text: The testcase works fine in Opera and Webkit. Both return 0.

This bug was reported on Firefox 2.x or older, which is no longer supported and will not be receiving any more updates. I strongly suggest that you update to Firefox 3.6.3 or later, update your plugins (flash, adobe, etc.), and retest in a new profile. If you still see the issue with the updated Firefox, please post here. Otherwise, please close as RESOLVED > WORKSFORME
http://www.mozilla.com
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Safe+mode
